paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark 

# If using S3 to host the data files, set your access key and secret here
# The ones provided below are no longer valid
sc._jsc.hadoopConfiguration().set('fs.s3n.awsAccessKeyId', 'AKIAIPWWBV7EZHFTQRKQ')
sc._jsc.hadoopConfiguration().set('fs.s3n.awsSecretAccessKey', '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')

%spark.pyspark

# Update the link to the data files (~11GB compressed)
news = sqlContext.read.json("s3://newsclustering/webhose-monthly-gz/*.json.gz")

%spark.sql

select thread.site, count(1) as num_articles
from news
group by  thread.site

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql

select concat(first(month(crawled)), ", ", first(year(crawled))), count(1) as num_articles
from news
group by  year(to_date(crawled)), month(to_date(crawled))
order by  year(to_date(crawled)), month(to_date(crawled))

keys.name: concat(CAST(first(month(CAST(crawled AS DATE)), false) AS STRING), , , CAST(first(year(CAST(crawled AS DATE)), false) AS STRING))

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Number of articles per domain per month

msg.data: Number of articles per domain per month

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql

select thread.site, concat(first(month(crawled)), ", ", first(year(crawled))) as date, count(1) as num_articles
from news
group by  thread.site, year(to_date(crawled)), month(to_date(crawled))
order by  year(to_date(crawled)), month(to_date(crawled))

keys.name: concat(CAST(first(month(CAST(crawled AS DATE)), false) AS STRING), , , CAST(first(year(CAST(crawled AS DATE)), false) AS STRING))

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Stratified sampling of the different domains

msg.data: Stratified sampling of the different domains

paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark

sample_count = 2000
frac = dict((e['site'], min(1, sample_count / float(e['count']))) for e in cc)

%md
## Verify that we roughly have the same number of articles per domain

msg.data: Verify that we roughly have the same number of articles per domain
